name: DoRothEA
title: Discriminant Regulon Expression Analysis
short_description: Framework to estimate single sample TF activities from gene expression data based on a manually curated human regulon.
long_description: DoRothEA is a gene set resource containing signed transcription factor (TF) - target interactions first described in Garcia-Alonso et al., 2019. The collection of a TF and its transcriptional targets is defined as regulon. DoRothEA regulons were curated and collected from different types of evidence such as literature curated resources, ChIP-seq peaks, TF binding site motifs and interactions inferred directly from gene expression.

input_files.name: input_reads
input_files.description: Gene expression matrix with genes (HGNC/MGI symbols) in rows and samples in columns.
input_files.help: The object can be a simple matrix/data frame or complexer objects such as ExpressionSet Seurat or SingleCellExperiment objects.

arguments.name: confidence_level
arguments.description: Confidence level based on the number of supporting evidence.
arguments.help: The confidence assigment comprises five levels, ranging from A (highest confidence) to E (lowest confidence).

arguments.name: minsize
arguments.description: Minimal number of genes in regulons.
arguments.help: Number of genes targeted by a specific transcription factor.

arguments.name: method
arguments.help: Character string indicating the method for computing the single samples signature, either scale, rank, mad, ttest or none

meta_data.description: Normalized enrichment scores for Transciption Factors
